original_solution_mapping.L1: Amanda has gone on 7 hikes x 8 = <<7*8=56>>56 hikes.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Steven has gone on 56 hikes + 15 hikes = <<56+15=71>>71 hikes.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6612.
    Returns: the number of weeks it would take Camila to achieve her goal.
    """
    # L1
    camila_hikes = 7 # Camila has only gone hiking 7 times
    amanda_multiplier = 8 # Amanda has gone on 8 times as many hikes as Camila
    amanda_hikes = camila_hikes * amanda_multiplier

    # L2
    steven_additional_hikes = 15 # Steven has gone on 15 more hikes than Amanda
    steven_hikes = amanda_hikes + steven_additional_hikes

    # L3
    hikes_camila_needs = steven_hikes - camila_hikes

    # L4
    hikes_per_week = 4 # plans to go on 4 hikes a week
    weeks_to_achieve_goal = hikes_camila_needs / hikes_per_week

    # FA
    answer = weeks_to_achieve_goal
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Amanda has gone on {camila_hikes} hikes x {amanda_multiplier} = <<{camila_hikes}*{amanda_multiplier}={amanda_hikes}>>{amanda_hikes} hikes.
Steven has gone on {amanda_hikes} hikes + {steven_additional_hikes} hikes = <<{amanda_hikes}+{steven_additional_hikes}={steven_hikes}>>{steven_hikes} hikes.
Camila needs to go on another {steven_hikes} hikes - {camila_hikes} hikes = <<{steven_hikes}-{camila_hikes}={hikes_camila_needs}>>{hikes_camila_needs} hikes.
Camila will achieve her goal in {hikes_camila_needs} hikes / {hikes_per_week} hikes/week = <<{hikes_camila_needs}/{hikes_per_week}={weeks_to_achieve_goal}>>{weeks_to_achieve_goal} weeks.
